data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly for Search Engine Market Dominance
data.Description: A federal judge ruled that Google maintains an illegal monopoly in the search engine market, primarily through anti-competitive agreements with companies like Apple to be the default search provider.

data.Title: Apple Rejects Bing as Default Search Engine, Even for "Whole Company"
data.Description: Apple has firmly stated that it will not replace Google with Bing as the default search engine on Safari, even if Microsoft offered the entire company. This decision highlights Apple's satisfaction with Google's revenue sharing and search quality.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads Now Feature Photos for Improved Visibility
data.Description: Google Local Service Ads will now showcase photos from advertisers' profiles, potentially boosting ad rank and engagement. This update aims to provide a more visually appealing and informative experience for users.

data.Title: Google Tests New "Short Videos" Tab in Search Results
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a new layout for accessing more videos in search results. Instead of dynamically loading, clicking "More Videos" might redirect users to a dedicated "Short Videos" tab.

data.Title: Google Ads Experiences Bugs, Issues Million-Dollar Credits by Mistake
data.Description: Google Ads faced a series of technical glitches, including a major reporting outage and erroneous credit notices worth millions of dollars sent to some advertisers. Google acknowledged the issues and is working on resolutions.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces Site Improvement Recommendations
data.Description: Google Search Console now offers personalized recommendations to help website owners enhance their site's performance in search results. These recommendations leverage data from Search Console to provide actionable insights.

data.Title: Google Ads to Migrate Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will soon transition Smart Campaign features into Performance Max campaigns, aiming to streamline campaign management and offer enhanced capabilities to advertisers.
